p: Starting with a bioinformatic analysis of flaviviral genomes, we defined several types of mutations and used them for the design of eight re-encoded sequences. The re-encoded viruses were derived from the wild-type Asibi strain and the hamster-adapted Ap7M strain, with which they were compared both in vitro and in vivo through fitness assays, infection assays and complete genome deep-sequencing. Although only the most heavily re-encoded virus (741 mutations) showed an observable decrease in replicative fitness in vitro, a range of attenuation levels was observed for the re-encoded variants when tested in vivo. The lowest impact was observed for strains that were re-encoded with transitions that did not include new CpG/UpA dinucleotides. In addition, we showed that the strains with the most attenuated phenotypes in vivo could induce robust protective immunity in hamsters following challenge with the lethal YF Ap7M virus.
